SI-ratio

Source: R/siratio.R
siratio.Rd

SI-ratio

Usage

siratio(x, ...)

siratioplot(
  x,
  labels = NULL,
  add = FALSE,
  box = TRUE,
  col.s = "darkblue",
  col.i = "gray",
  col.mean = "red",
  cex.i = 0.1,
  lwd.s = par("lwd"),
  lwd.mean = lwd.s,
  main = "SI ratio",
  xlab = NULL,
  ylab = NULL,
  xlim = NULL,
  ylim = NULL,
  start = NULL,
  end = NULL,
  ...
)

ggsiratioplot(
  x,
  labels = NULL,
  col.s = "darkblue",
  col.i = "gray",
  col.mean = "red",
  cex.i = 0.5,
  lwd.s = 1,
  lwd.mean = lwd.s,
  main = "SI ratio",
  xlab = NULL,
  ylab = NULL,
  start = NULL,
  end = NULL,
  ...
)

Arguments

x

input model or data.

...

unused parameters.

labels

labels.

add

boolean indicating whether a new plot should be drawn.

box

boolean indicating a box around the current plot should be drawn.

col.s, col.i, col.mean

colors of the different components.

cex.i, lwd.s, lwd.mean

graphical parameters.

main, xlab, ylab

title, X and Y axis label.

xlim, ylim

X and Y axis limits.

start, end

first and last dates plotted.

Examples

x <- RJDemetra::x13(ipi_c_eu[,"FR"])
siratioplot(x)

ggsiratioplot(x)
